data.title: Cmd+Q doesn't auto-save workspace state
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Os X 10.11.6 - El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a file and do not save it.
2. Hit on Cmd+Q (Quit)

Would be nice if app could just quit and when reopening just load the previous state.

This is more a Feature request than an issue.

data.title: TypeError: Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of undefined
Allow to always use indentation with tab

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Every time I try to change the indentation mode of a file to use tabulation, it get back to spaces as soon as I press enter.

All I can do is convert to tab each time I make an edit in the file… It’s very frustrating.

Please allow us to set a default setting for the indentation, once and for all, globally.

Example : 

```
"editor.indentationMode": "tab" // (or "space")
```

data.title: Use blankline to delimit html block in markdown colorization
data.body:
**Bug** Issue #7725 Nested html is not colorized properly for markdown: ``` md # Should Colorize
# should not colorize
# should not colorize
# should not colorize
# should not colorize
# Should Colorize fdsafsa ``` ![screen shot 2016-09-20 at 6 29 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18694594/37ab6a72-7f60-11e6-9b2f-a385ad4876fa.png) **Fix** According to the commonmark spec, general html blocks end with a blank line: http://spec.commonmark.org/0.25/#html-blocks This change relaxes the `while` for html blocks so that we only check for blank lines, instead of trying to match the start tag (which is fragile and fails when nesting the same type of element) ![screen shot 2016-09-20 at 6 30 19 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18694606/4e191b7e-7f60-11e6-8c51-aff5ab5609f7.png) Closes #7725

data.title: Feature Request: api to custom files sort order at the sidebar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: mac

data.title: Inconsistent Markdown Colorization For Inline Element Inside Lists or Block Quotes
data.body:
For a markdown file like this:

``` md
[abc](http://example.com) *fdsa*

* [abc](http://example.com) *fdsa*

> [abc](http://example.com) *fdsa*
```

The inline link and italic elements are styled differently inside of lists and block quotes:

![screen shot 2016-09-20 at 5 39 12 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18693764/39e30eaa-7f59-11e6-83a0-393ec2aa7653.png)

This varies by theme:

![sep-20-2016 17-36-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18693774/489a12ae-7f59-11e6-8e30-9331bf37e372.gif)

This does not seem expected, but I could be wrong.

The main problem does not seem to be our tokenization, rather the css syntax styling selectors for tokens in lists and block quote have higher precedence than the rules for normal inline markdown elements. In the case of a link in a list, we use `.token.markup.list` for all elements inside the list, while the link description in the body is only targeted by `.token.string`. The more targeted list token selector ends up overriding the `font-color` from the regular inline link one.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use emojis on TSX files 2. Try to delete an emoji (sometimes Backspace inserts an unknown symbol (an ? inside a losang), most of the times, it just crashes) Code: `📚Artigos3` Workaround: 1. Select and [delete] the emoji character

data.title: Fix markdown highlighting for fenced code block close with space prefix
data.body:
Issue #8636

**Bug**
Fenced code block closing tags break colorization if they are prefixed with spaces like so:

``````
*a*

```json
{}
  ```

*b*
``````

 According to the commonmark spec, up to three spaces are allowed: http://spec.commonmark.org/0.25/#fenced-code-blocks

**Fix**
Update defintion of fenced code block closing tag to support up to three spaces before and any number of spaces after.

Closes #8636

data.title: No C# support even with C# extension installed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

VSCode has stopped listing C# as an available language.  It opens all *.cs files as plain text and C# is not selectable as a file type.  I have the C# extension installed. I have attempted uninstalling and reinstalling the current extension, VSCode in its entirety, and the legacy C# extension.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have C# extension installed
2. `dotnet new` a new project
3. Open `Program.cs` from Explorer or via `code .` in the directory or `code Program.cs`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20667293/18691631/a47fe978-7f49-11e6-9c77-846513000a47.png)

data.body:

e.g. add background color or line-height to '.monaco-workbench' element?

I can see I can override a lot of coding style/highlighting from *.tmTheme file but not the editor's UI css.

data.title: GoToDefinition is not available in [metadata] files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a C# project with the content:
   
   ``` cs
   class Foo
   {
       System.Collections.Generic.List<int> bar;
   }
   ```
2. Invoke <kbd>F12</kbd> `GoToDefinition` on `List` to be taken to the metadata file for `List`1` (`public class List<T> : IList<T>...`
3. In this file, `GoToDefinition` is not an option on `IList<T>` and pressing <kbd>F12</kbd> on it does nothing.

Other language service things like tooltips are also not available.

data.title: onWillSaveTextDocument event
data.body: This PR implements #239 by adding a `onWillSaveTextDocument` which allows for pre-save modifications of a document. The API around that is still in discussion.
